meanings.definition: To obtain goods or services from within a company rather than from an external source.
meanings.sent1: Our company decided to insource the production of our products to save money.
meanings.sent2: It is more cost-effective for us to insource our IT support rather than hiring an external company.
meanings.sent3: The team celebrated when they were told they would insource the catering for the office party.
meanings.sent4: By insourcing the manufacturing process, we have better control over the quality of our products.
meanings.sent5: Insourcing the customer service department has improved our response times significantly.

meanings.definition: To bring work or tasks into a company that were previously outsourced.
meanings.sent1: After realizing the benefits, the company decided to insource their marketing efforts.
meanings.sent2: The decision to insource the accounting department proved to be a wise move for the company.
meanings.sent3: The employees were excited to insource the graphic design work and showcase their talents.
meanings.sent4: Insourcing the software development team has led to faster project completion.
meanings.sent5: The decision to insource the cleaning services has resulted in a cleaner and more organized workspace.
